org.tinfour.gis.shapefile

Class ShapefileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinfour.gis.shapefile.ShapefileReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class ShapefileReader
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Provides a partial implementation of a Shapefile reader intended to support testing of the Constrained Delaunay Triangulation feature of the Tinfour software library. The present version is based on the assumption that the Shapefile supplies constraints. More general applicastions are not currently supported. Only a few Shapefile types are supported.

      • readNextRecord

        public ShapefileRecord readNextRecord(ShapefileRecord pRecord)
                               throws IOException
        Reads the next record in the Shapefile. This method takes a reusable instance of the ShapefileRecord class. If a null is passed in, it creates a new instance. If a valid reference is supplied, the method returns the reference that was supplied.
        Parameters:
        pRecord - a reusable instance to store data, or a null if the method is to allocate a new instance.
        Returns:
        if successful, a valid instance of ShapefileRecord
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of a file format error or unepected I/O condition

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Checks to see if there are any more records remaining to be read
        Returns:
        true if more records remain; otherwise false.

      • getCoFile

        public File getCoFile(String extension)
        Get a reference to the file that shares the same root name as the Shapefile but has an alternate extension. For example, this method could be used to get a reference to the DBF or PRJ file.

        Capitalization does not matter under Windows, but does apply under Linux operating systems. Therefore, this method will try to find the matching file based on the following three rules:

        1. Look for a file with an extension having the same capitalization as the main Shapefile
        2. Look for a file having the extension as all lower case letters
        3. Look for a file having the extension with all upper case letters
        While there are other possible capitalization configurations, writing code to support them seems silly and is not implemented at this time.
        Parameters:
        extension - a string giving the target extension (do not include period)
        Returns:
        if found, a valid instance; otherwise, a null

      • getDbfFileReader

        public DbfFileReader getDbfFileReader()
                               throws IOException
        Get an DBF file reader for the current Shapefile
        Returns:
        if successful, a valid DbfFileReader instance.
        Throws:
